entity.name: Streetlives
entity.description: Streetlives is an NYC-based non-profit that empowers unhoused individuals through digital products rooted in lived experience.

projects.name: YourPeer
projects.description: YourPeer connects unhoused New Yorkers to services that meet their needs and providers to the communities they serve.

channels.description: Pay with your debit/credit card through this gateway and setup recurring subscriptions.

plans.name: One-off Streetlives donation
plans.description: Each contribution to Streetlives provides a stipend to unhoused people or people who have experienced homelessness. $30 enables up to a half-hour of co-design or consultation to help improve our technology or work in the field to gather, validate, and curate social services data for the whole community's benefit.

plans.name: Individual Streetlives backer
plans.description: Each $50 for Streetlives provides a stipend for unhoused people or people who have experienced homelessness to help build technology connecting service-seekers to social services and improve the social service system. Your contribution enables up to one hour of co-design or consultation to improve our digital tools or work in the field to gather, validate, and curate social services data for the whole community's benefit.

plans.name: $50 gift to Streetlives
plans.description: Each $50 for Streetlives provides a stipend for unhoused people or people who have experienced homelessness to help build technology connecting service-seekers to social services and improve the social service system. Your contribution enables up to one hour of co-design or consultation to improve our digital tools or work in the field to gather, validate, and curate social services data for the whole community's benefit.

plans.name: Individual+ Streetlives backer
plans.description: Each $75 for Streetlives provides a stipend for unhoused people or people who have experienced homelessness to help build technology connecting service-seekers to social services and improve the social service system. Your contribution enables up to 90 minutes of co-design or consultation to improve our digital tools or work in the field to gather, validate, and curate social services data for the whole community's benefit.

plans.name: Help hire a lived-expert employee
plans.description: Your gift of $10,000 or more will go toward hiring a person with unhoused lived experience to work with Streetlives as a Community Information Specialist, part-time for one year.
